alert.note: Alert for Central Cook; Northern Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 2:16PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cook County through 245 PM CDT... At 216 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Morton Grove, or over Niles, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... North side of Chicago, Evanston, Skokie, Des Plaines, Glenview, Park Ridge, Niles, West Ridge, Lake View, Irving Park, Lincoln Park, Wilmette, Edgewater, Rogers Park, Albany Park, Uptown, Portage Park, Morton Grove, Lincolnwood and Winnetka. This includes...Loyola University, Northeastern Illinois University, Northwestern University, and Wrigley Field. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
